headline: BNSF hires Goldman, CSX seeks bankers as Union Pacific sparks rail M&A race, sources say
summary: (Reuters) -BNSF Railway has hired Goldman Sachs and CSX Corp is in talks to bring on financial advisers, as rival Union Pacific’s interest in acquiring Norfolk Southern sparked a wave of deal preparations that could reshape the U.S. freight rail industry, sources said.  The moves by BNSF, owned by Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway, and Jacksonville-based CSX come after Union Pacific began exploring a potential acquisition of Norfolk Southern, which could create a $200 billion coast-to-coast rail network and mark the most significant consolidation in the sector in decades.  Goldman and CSX declined to comment.

Goldman and CSX declined to comment.

headline: Berkshire-owned BNSF taps bankers for its own rail acquisition
summary: BNSF has underperformed rivals over the last few years, but can’t afford to sit on the dealmaking sideline.

headline: PHOENIX INVESTORS ACQUIRES FORMER ANCHOR GLASS FACILITY IN JACKSONVILLE, FL
summary: An affiliate of Milwaukee-based commercial real estate firm Phoenix Investors ("Phoenix"), a national leader in the revitalization of former manufacturing facilities, announced the acquisition of 2121 Huron Street in Jacksonville, Florida. The transaction adds approximately 628,000 square feet of industrial space to Phoenix's growing national portfolio.

headline: Norfolk Southern Declares Quarterly Dividend
summary: Norfolk Southern Corporation (NYSE: NSC) announced today a quarterly dividend of $1.35 per share on its common stock.

headline: Is Merger on the Cards Between Union Pacific & Norfolk Southern?
summary: UNP and NSC are in early merger talks, eyeing a historic West-to-East freight line. However, regulatory hurdles loom large.

raw.headline: Is Merger on the Cards Between Union Pacific & Norfolk Southern?

headline: TD Cowen upgrades Norfolk Southern and CSX on rising takeover odds
summary: Investing.com -- TD Cowen upgraded shares of Norfolk Southern (NYSE:NSC) and CSX (NASDAQ:CSX) to Buy on expectations that a wave of U.S. rail consolidation could be set in motion by a likely Union Pacific (NYSE:UNP) bid for Norfolk. Brokerage believes that such a move would prompt BNSF to pursue CSX, shrinking the number of U.S. Class I railroads from four to two. BNSF is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE:BRKa).The upgrade follows a Wall Street Journal report suggesting UNP i

headline: Analysis: UP-NS rail merger spotlights individual legacies in a legacy business
summary: In a business as tightly coupled to its past as railroading, there is much at stake for several individuals in the proposed Union Pacific-Norfolk Southern merger. The post Analysis: UP-NS rail merger spotlights individual legacies in a legacy business appeared first on FreightWaves.
